This hotel is not for everyone as the rooms are small and some people don't like tech and gadgets. But, I loved it. 
It's a great location. You check yourself in and it's easy. There's human help if you need it. The lobby is like a very large living constructed so people can work on their laptops and devices. The elevators are fast as is the WiFi. The place is super clean.
The rooms are small but they have everything you need. The temperature, TV, lights, and blinds are all controlled by a provided iPad. You can even change the colors of your lighting and set your own ambiance to the room. The shower is a standup and can snugly fit two people. The sink is in the main room. The bed is big enough for two people. There is a small desk provided but you'd rather work in the lobby/living room because it's so nice. 
At the Miami location, breakfast is about $20 and it's good and has all the usual stuff you'll find in a hotel buffet breakfast. The coffee is very good.
You also get two drink vouchers when you check in. There's also a rooftop pool and bar.

The best thing about the place is the staff. The people are so freaking nice. They never treat you like a burden. They treat you like a friend and if you stay long enough, you get to know them. I loved meeting and talking to Ace, Annie, Jeffrey, and Shekayama (I probably messed that one up). SO NICE! One of them even gave me a going-away gift.

I don't give glowing reviews like this. I really did love this place. In all my future travels, I will be looking for CitizenM.

Review Title: Hightech Hotel missing Humanity at Checkout desk
Negative Reviews:
I recently had the opportunity to stay at this hotel, and while the accommodations themselves were satisfactory, I am disappointed to report that my experience with the hotel staff was less than pleasant.

During check-in, I found the staff at the front desk to be quite rude, which set an unfortunate tone for the rest of my stay. To make matters worse, when I attempted to inquire about the checkout process, I was repeatedly ignored by a particular staff member, despite my requests for assistance. Eventually, after several minutes of attempting to get her attention, she reluctantly addressed my concerns.

Unfortunately, this interaction only further soured my experience, as I was informed that the price I had been quoted for my stay was incorrect and that I would need to pay additional fees. Additionally, I was informed that there was no option to pay in cash, which was an inconvenience.

To add insult to injury, I was disappointed to learn that during the ultra weekend, the hotel was blocking guest friends  from accessing the bar or changing their clothes. While it was still possible to find a way in, this was a major letdown for me, as I was looking forward to enjoying the amenities the hotel had to offer.

Overall, while the hotel itself was fine, I cannot recommend it due to the poor service I received from the staff. It is clear that the staff could benefit from additional training in how to work with guests and provide a more positive experience. Until these issues are addressed, I will not be returning to this hotel.
